paramInformation.label: Power Wattage Report Value Threshold
paramInformation.description: Choose how you want your Power Strip to report power consumption to your hub

paramInformation.label: Power Wattage Report Frequency
paramInformation.description: The number entered as value corresponds to the number of seconds

paramInformation.label: Energy (kWh) Report Frequency
paramInformation.description: Report interval of power consumption (W) to your controller (hub)

paramInformation.label: Overload Protection
paramInformation.description: Set the Watt level for overload protection to kick in

paramInformation.label: CH1 Auto Turn-Off Setting
paramInformation.description: Time in minutes to turn off the device connected to CH1 after being turned on

paramInformation.label: CH1 Auto Turn-On Setting
paramInformation.description: Time in minutes to turn on the device connected to CH1 after being turned off.

paramInformation.label: CH2 Auto Turn-Off Setting
paramInformation.description: Time in minutes to turn off the device connected to CH2 after being turned on

paramInformation.label: CH2 Auto Turn-On Setting
paramInformation.description: Time in minutes to turn on the device connected to CH2 after being turned off

paramInformation.label: CH3 Auto Turn-Off Setting
paramInformation.description: Time in minutes to turn off the device connected to CH3 after being turned on

paramInformation.label: CH3 Auto Turn-On Setting
paramInformation.description: Time in minutes to turn on the device connected to CH3 after being turned off

paramInformation.label: CH4 Auto Turn-Off Setting
paramInformation.description: Time in minutes to turn off the device connected to CH4 after being turned on.

paramInformation.label: CH4 Auto Turn-On Setting
paramInformation.description: Time in minutes to turn on the device connected to CH4 after being turned off

paramInformation.label: CH5 Auto Turn-Off Setting
paramInformation.description: Time in minutes to turn off the device connected to CH5 after being turned on.

paramInformation.label: CH5 Auto Turn-On Setting
paramInformation.description: Time in minutes to turn on the device connected to CH5 after being turned off

options.label: LED on when power is off and off when power is on
LED on when power is on and off when power is off
LED is always off, regardless of power status

metadata.inclusion:
1. Follow the instructions for your Z-Wave certified controller to include a device to 
 the Z-Wave network.
2. Once the controller is ready to include your device, press up and release the toggle 
 to include it in the network.
3. Once your controller has confirmed that the device has been included, refresh the 
 Z-Wave network to optimize performance.
4. The device is associated in the same group when it included in setting process. 
 Now you can control your Z-Wave device according to groups, scenes, schedules and automation programmed
metadata.exclusion:
1. Plug the power strip into a grounded receptacle located within 3 feet from your Z-Wave gateway controller

2. Put your Z-Wave controller in exclusion mode

3. Press and release the power button on the strip

4. The device should disappear from your controller's device list
metadata.reset: When your network’s primary controller is missing or otherwise inoperable, you may need to reset the device to factory settings manually. In order to complete the process, plug the power strip into a grounded receptacle, then PRESS AND HOLD the power button for AT LEAST 3 SECONDS. NOTE: All previously recorded activity and custom settings will be erased from the device’s memory
